channel.title: YouTube - RiiPiiNFtW Gaming Channel
channel.description:
So I recently invested into some xbox equipment to produce videos and thought I could use this forum to get some feedback on my videos. I will be uploading small clips of halo 4 every other days. I will expand here soon once I get the rest of what I bought in a week.
Here is my channel: http://www.youtube.com/user/riipiinftwgaming
Please provide feedback as I post new clips or videos.
Here is my first video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SghJXYg6KOc
Second Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tkt67Z-vc9Q
First Successful troll: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VOvn5MYeOY8
My first Fail-Tage: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5xG4_W5rGoc
First game since weapon tune: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XN-WJgV3yAA

item.title: YouTube - RiiPiiNFtW Gaming Channel

item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:18, topic:519006”]I’m confused as to why if other people come and advertise their youtube channels or whatever they get their topic locked or removed, but this isn’t. Should at least be consistent, allow youtube channel advertising or don’t… but don’t only allow it for moparians or whatever (personally I think it should be allowed)[/quote]I asked Tom if it was ok for me to post this to receive feed back on my videos as I am just starting. I am not posting this to advertise (although it is a way to get 1 or 2), but the feedback is extremely important to me because I’m not all that great at editing.

Read full topic

item.title: YouTube - RiiPiiNFtW Gaming Channel
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:11, topic:519006”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=637458.msg4296998#msg4296998 date=1368390292]

Might have to try that
[/quote]I will try to get other computer related gaming videos up once I get a gaming computer, which is no time soon. I currently have no time to buy one, but I will probably end up building one later this year or next year.

Alright. You can build a decent one for ~$300 if you live in the US; if you live in Europe I think it’s more like $600 for the same specs :o[/quote]

I’m from the UK and pay about 5-10% more for components than Americans do. The kicker is that, I pay a mere 5-10% more on components that include the 20% VAT than Americans do for components without tax. Unless Americans pay less than 5-10% tax for components, I pay less with a substantially higher tax rate.

PS, $300 will buy you an incredibly low end gaming rig, if you’re simply upgrading and just need a new CPU and video card then it’ll buy a mid-low end gaming rig. These terms apply to PC only, I have no doubts a $300 rig will vastly outperform consoles.

Read full topic
